question:
Which of the following is/ are correct statements about the National Anti-Profiteering Authority (NAA)?
  1. The authority is headed by the Union Finance Minister
  2. The authority aims to ensure the transfer of benefits of input tax credits and reduced GST rates reaches to consumers
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: <u>First statement is incorrect</u> because the National Anti-Profiteering Authority (NAA) will be headed by a senior officer of the level of Secretary to the Government of India. There will be four Technical Members from the Centre and/or the States. <u>Second statement is correct</u> because the “anti-profiteering” measures enshrined in the GST law provide an institutional mechanism to ensure that the full benefits of input tax credits and reduced GST rates on supply of goods or services flow to the consumers.
